mills jackson well the intent is not to have the government restricting free speech  other than incitement   other aggrieved citizens can sue if that free speech causes reputational damage

free speech ends   where defamation begins   the real facts  for educational purposes  alex jones finds out the hard way that lies have consequences  defamation   meaning  a false statement of fact  spoken or published  with fault  as a result of negligence or malice   types of defamation  a  slander   meaning  the action or crime of making a false spoken statement damaging to a person or an entities reputation  b  libel   meaning  the action or crime of making a false published statement damaging to a person or an entities reputation  c  the proof   prima facie  to prove  prima facie  defamation  a plaintiff must show four things  1  the defendant s  made a false statement purporting to be fact  2  the defendant s  published or communicated that false statement to a third person   3  the defendant s  is are at fault amounting to  at least  negligence  4  the defendant s  caused some harm or damage to a persons or entities reputation that is the subject of the false statement  end of education  you are welcome
